metadata.title: CVE-2022-48619 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/input/input.c in the Linux kernel before5.17.10. An attacker can cause a denial of service (panic) becauseinput_set_capability mishandles the situation in which an event code fallsoutside of a bitmap.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1149-azure - 4.15.0-1149.164~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-257.291~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1134.140').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1149.164~14.04.1').
